intro: Galega ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it typically grows in dry, open habitats. Galega ochroleuca is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
